meanings.definition: The quality or state of being unsociable.
meanings.sent1: Her unsociability made it difficult for her to make friends.
meanings.sent2: His unsociability often led to him spending weekends alone.
meanings.sent3: Despite his unsociability, he found solace in his books.
meanings.sent4: The unsociability of the old house gave it a mysterious aura.
meanings.sent5: The unsociability of the cat was evident as it hid from visitors.

meanings.definition: The tendency to avoid social interactions.
meanings.sent1: His unsociability was evident when he declined all party invitations.
meanings.sent2: The unsociability of the shy student made group projects challenging.
meanings.sent3: The unsociability of the bear was evident as it wandered alone in the forest.
meanings.sent4: The unsociability of the clouds kept the sky gloomy all day.
meanings.sent5: The unsociability of the hermit was legendary in the small town.

meanings.definition: Lack of interest in or enjoyment of social activities.
meanings.sent1: Her unsociability was misunderstood as aloofness by her classmates.
meanings.sent2: The unsociability of the teenager worried his parents.
meanings.sent3: The unsociability of the robot made it perfect for solitary tasks.
meanings.sent4: The unsociability of the desert made it a harsh environment for life.
meanings.sent5: The unsociability of the painting left viewers feeling cold and distant.
